docs.snippet: South American military leaders have succeeded in crippling leftist extremism, but in the process many have condoned murder, torture, secret arrest and other abuses of human rights. Such methods, not new in Latin America, are being practiced in some...
docs.lead_paragraph: South American military leaders have succeeded in crippling leftist extremism, but in the process many have condoned murder, torture, secret arrest and other abuses of human rights. Such methods, not new in Latin America, are being practiced in some countries now to an extent seldom seen before.
docs.abstract: Article on human rights repression in Chile, Argentina, Uruguay, Paraguay, Brazil and Bolivia resulting from govts efforts to destroy leftist extremism; notes 6 countries are cooperating to prevent suspected extremists from seeking haven among them; Amnesty Internatl puts total of pol prisoners in Chile, Argentina, Uruguay and Brazil at 30,000 (M)

headline.main: Human Rights Group Reports Repression in South America; 'Unmistakable Deterioration' High Death Tolls Reported Cooperation Against Fugitives 'Some Worse Than Others' 'I See No Other Choice'

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: AMERICAN NATIONS AND WESTERN HEMISPHERE POSSESSIONS

docs.snippet: PARIS, Oct. 31 (UPI) Eddie Dibbs defeated Jaime Fillol of Chile in a three-hour match today to win the $50,000 Paris Grand Prix tennis tournament. The scores were 5-7, 6-4, 6-4, 7-6, before 3,000 fans.
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS, Oct. 31 (UPI) Eddie Dibbs defeated Jaime Fillol of Chile in a three-hour match today to win the $50,000 Paris Grand Prix tennis tournament. The scores were 5-7, 6-4, 6-4, 7-6, before 3,000 fans.

headline.main: Dibbs Defeats Fillol in 4 Sets In Paris Final

docs.snippet: Hector Mennoni, UPI bur mgr in Uruguay, is arrested by police, held for 15 hrs and then released; UPI spokesman says police wanted to know source for article recently written by Mennoni about pol prisoners in Uruguay (S)
docs.abstract: Hector Mennoni, UPI bur mgr in Uruguay, is arrested by police, held for 15 hrs and then released; UPI spokesman says police wanted to know source for article recently written by Mennoni about pol prisoners in Uruguay (S)

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 20  Prince Sadruddin Aga Khan, the United Nations' High Commissioner for Refugees, has charged governments with paying little heed to the human rights pact they adopted as a basis for humanitarian laws.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 20 Prince Sadruddin Aga Khan, the United Nations' High Commissioner for Refugees, has charged governments with paying little heed to the human rights pact they adopted as a basis for humanitarian laws.
docs.abstract: UN High Comr for Refugees Prince Sadruddin Aga Khan appeals to govts to accept refugees from Chile, Uruguay and Brazil now in Argentina (S)

headline.main: Refugee Official in U.N. Says Governments Do Not Need Human Rights Commitments

byline.original: By KATHLEEN TELTSCH Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 21 The United Nations High Commission for Refugees has asked Uruguay's military Government to explain how Uruguayan exiles abducted in Argentina have turned up in Uruguayan jails.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 21 The United Nations High Commission for Refugees has asked Uruguay's military Government to explain how Uruguayan exiles abducted in Argentina have turned up in Uruguayan jails.
docs.abstract: UN High Comr for Refugees asks Uruguay to explain how Uruguayan exiles abducted in July and Oct in Argentina turn up in Uruguayan jails; has taken interest in 20,000 refugees from Chile, Uruguay, Bolivia, Paraguay and Brazil in Argentina; many who had left-wing ties in own country face combined repression of Argentine security forces and intelligence forces of own countries, which are allowed to operate in Argentina; Uruguayan communique holds detainees faked abductions in Argentine as cover for entering Uruguay secretly; cases of several detainees noted (M)

headline.main: Report Is Sought On Exiles' Return To Uruguay Jails

byline.original: By JUAN de ONIS Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 22 (Reuters) Enrique Rodriguez Fabregat, a former delegate to the United Nations who played a leading role in setting up the state of Israel in 1948, died here yesterday, members of his family said today.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 22 (Reuters) Enrique Rodriguez Fabregat, a former delegate to the United Nations who played a leading role in setting up the state of Israel in 1948, died here yesterday, members of his family said today.

headline.main: Enrique Rodriguez, Uruguayan in U.N., Helped Set Up Israel

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Dec. 6 Joao Goulart, the last civilian President of Brazil, died today at his ranch in northern Argentina, where he was in exile. He was 58 years old.
